byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and JAWAD SUKHANYAR

abstract: Taliban insurgents say they are on verge of taking city of Kunduz, Afghanistan, raising alarms, but Afghan government denies assertion; dispute highlights inflated claims made by both government and insurgents; developments, if confirmed, would represent first time in 2015 major city center in Afghanistan has been threatened by Taliban.
lead_paragraph: Taliban insurgents said Sunday that they were on the verge of taking their first Afghan city, Kunduz. But the central government said there was no cause for concern.

headline.main: Taliban and Afghan Government Dispute Status of Kunduz
headline.print_headline: Taliban and Afghans Dispute Status of a Northern City

snippet: Taliban insurgents said Sunday that they were on the verge of taking their first Afghan city, Kunduz. But the central government said there was no cause for concern.
